briefTitle: Tipranavir/Ritonavir vs. Genotypically Defined Protease Inhibitor/Ritonavir in HIV Patients (RESIST-2)
officialTitle: Randomized, Open-label, Comparative Safety and Efficacy Study of Tipranavir Boosted With Low Dose Ritonavir (TPV/RTV) Versus Genotypically-defined Protease Inhibitor/Ritonavir (PI/RTV) in Multiple Antiretroviral Drug-experienced Patients (RESIST 2: Randomized Evaluation of Strategic Intervention in Multi-Drug Resistant Patients With Tipranavir)
summary: The objective of this study is to demonstrate the safety and efficacy of tipranavir/ritonavir versus an active control arm in highly treatment experienced Human immunodeficiency virus-1 infected patients. Patients must have a viral load \> =1000 cells/mL, and genotype indicating at least one resistance conferring protease inhibitor-mutation as determined from a predefined panel of mutations. Any CD4+ count is acceptable.
